topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0 Beta: Installation Guide

titlealts.searchtitle: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0 Beta: Installation Overivew

body.p: This document describes the process for installing HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.

section.title: About the installation
section.p: The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation installs HP Helion Lifecycle Management VM, creates a base HP Helion OpenStack cloud, configures network virtualization through HP Distributed Cloud Networking (DCN), and deploys a carrier grade cloud.
After installation, you can interact with the HP Helion OpenStack cloud using the Horizon graphical interface or using the CLIs of the respective services.

body.section:
Installation options
HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade has two baremetal installation options depending on your system configuration. It allows you to manage the KVM and VMware ESX hypervisors and provision virtual machines.
You can find more information on the hypervisor options in the Technical Overview.
The following table indicates the components required for each deployment type. If your deployment indicates Yes in a column, you must install that component. If a column is blank, you can disregard that component.
Deployment All Deployments HP DCN VMware ESX Ironic Baremetal
Denver Yes
Tahoe Yes Yes
Memphis Yes Yes Yes
Sacramento Yes Yes Yes Yes
KVM Topology using the Denver Deployment
If installing the denver template, you are installing the KVM region and HP Helion OpenStack AVS networking.
You can also integrate HPE Storevirtual (VSA) or HPE StoreServ (3PAR) storage in the KVM region.
You must install 3PAR or VSA before starting the HP Helion OpenStack installation and are independent of HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. During the installation, you will integrate the storage into HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. See the installation instructions for the 3PAR and/or VSA parameters you will need.
Start installing the Denver deployment.
KVM with DCN Topology using the Tahoe Deployment
If you are installing the tahoe template, you are installing the KVM region and HP DCN VRS networking.
You can also integrate HPE Storevirtual (VSA) or HPE StoreServ (3PAR) storage in the KVM region.
You must install DCN, 3PAR or VSA before starting the HP Helion OpenStack installation and are independent of HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. During the installation, you will integrate the storage into HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. See the installation instructions for the 3PAR and/or VSA parameters you will need.
Start installing the Tahoe deployment.
KVM + ESX with DCN Topology using the Memphis Deployment
If you are installing the memphis template, you are installing the KVM region and VMware ESX storage. The networking uses HP DCN VRS.
You can also integrate HPE Storevirtual (VSA) or HPE StoreServ (3PAR) storage in the KVM region.
You must install DCN, ESX, and 3PAR and/or VSA before starting the HP Helion OpenStack installation and are independent of HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. During the installation, you will integrate the storage into HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. See the installation instructions for the 3PAR and/or VSA parameters you will need.Start installing the Memphis deployment.
KVM + ESX + Ironic with DCN Topology using the Sacramento Deployment
If you are installing the sacramento template, you are installing the KVM region, VMware ESX storage, and a baremetal region (controlled by OpenStack Ironic). The networking uses HP DCN VRS.
You will need to perform tasks to integrate ESX and DCN with HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.
You can also integrate HPE Storevirtual (VSA) or HPE StoreServ (3PAR) storage in the KVM region.
You must install DCN, ESX, and 3PAR and/or VSA before starting the HP Helion OpenStack installation and are independent of HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. During the installation, you will integrate the storage into HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. See the installation instructions for the 3PAR and/or VSA parameters you will need.
Start installing the Sacramento deployment.
